parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From pro and histemi; to stand before, i.e. to preside, or to practise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Subjection, submission, obedience. From hupotasso; subordination.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Dignity, honor, gravity, seriousness. From semnos; venerableness, i.e. Probity.
